alert.note: Alert for Calhoun; Gulf; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Tornado Warning issued April 27 at 2:49PM EDT until April 27 at 3:15PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: The National Weather Service in Tallahassee has issued a * Tornado Warning for... North central Gulf County in the Panhandle of Florida... Southern Calhoun County in the Panhandle of Florida... West central Liberty County in Big Bend of Florida... * Until 315 PM EDT/215 PM CDT/. * At 249 PM EDT/149 PM CDT/, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located 8 miles northwest of Stonemill Creek, or 16 miles southwest of Blountstown, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This tornadic thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Gulf, southern Calhoun Counties in the Panhandle of Florida and west central Liberty Counties in Big Bend of Florida, including the following locations... Marysville, Scotts Ferry, Estiffanulga, Kinard, Lewis, Woods, Hugh Creek, Chipola Park, Central City and Orange. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
